summary: "Wreck-It Ralph," a 2012 Disney animated film, tells the story of Ralph, a video game villain who wants to be a hero. Directed by Rich Moore, the movie features voices by John C. Reilly, Sarah Silverman, and others. Ralph rebels against his bad guy role and goes on an adventure to prove himself. The film was a hit, making over $496 million and winning awards, including Best Animated Feature at the Annie Awards. A sequel, "Ralph Breaks the Internet," came out in 2018.
title: Wreck-It Ralph
